title: Best Brownies Recipe (with Video)
description: This brownie recipe makes moist, delicious brownies that are cakey on the outside and fudgy in the middle. The chocolate frosting makes them the best!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Desserts Cookies Brownie Recipes Chocolate Brownie Recipes Best Brownies 4.6 (13,853) 10,894 Reviews 1,532 Photos This brownie recipe makes rich, fudgy brownies that always turn out well. They're topped with homemade chocolate frosting to make the best brownies ever! Submitted by Angie Updated on January 27, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 1,532 1,532 1,532 1,532 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 16 Yield: 16 brownies Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 16 servings ½ cup butter 1 cup white sugar 2 large eggs 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ⅓ cup unsweetened cocoa powder ½ cup all-purpose flour ¼ teaspoon salt ¼ teaspoon baking powder Frosting: 3 tablespoons butter, softened 3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder 1 tablespoon honey 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1 cup confectioners' sugar Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan. Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large saucepan. Remove from heat, and stir in sugar, eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/3 cup cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until top is dry and edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool briefly before frosting. To make the chocolate frosting: Combine softened butter, confectioners' sugar, 3 tablespoons cocoa, honey, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract in a bowl. Stir until smooth. Frost brownies while they are still warm. Kim I Made It Print 25,596 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 184 Calories 9g Fat 25g Carbs 2g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 16 Calories 184 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 11% Saturated Fat 5g 26% Cholesterol 44mg 15% Sodium 113mg 5% Total Carbohydrate 25g 9% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 20g Protein 2g 4% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 11mg 1% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 17mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Best Brownies 01 of 1,532 Photo by  Kim 02 of 1,532 Photo by  CopperAle4300 04/08/2025 Easy to follow Great flavors A keeper! Simple instructions, rich and tasty! Great size for a family of 4-6 without the next day leftovers. I will continue to refer back to this recipe. *I did substitute with gluten free flour and added semi-sweet chocolate chips into the mix. :) 03 of 1,532 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 04/05/2025 the best! thank you for this recipe ❤️ 04 of 1,532 Photo by  funfoodie22 03/20/2025 This was so delicious! I added some crushed peanuts on top along with a homemade mixture of crushed peanuts and mini marshmallows. So good! I will definitely make it again. 05 of 1,532 Photo by  Vonnie 03/17/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors Delicious wouldn’t change a thing easily to follow 06 of 1,532 Photo by  Yaz 02/11/2025 Really good! Used powdered sugar on top. Making it again with the frosting. Was a hit for Superbowl. 07 of 1,532 Photo by  GiftedPrune8708 02/09/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Good stuff! I was trying to mix frosting and it’s not liquid enough and I turn stove on to make it good. 08 of 1,532 Photo by  SneakyOats4669 02/03/2025 A keeper! Very delicious, very rich, very yum! 09 of 1,532 Photo by  chef pirito 01/26/2025 Crowd-pleaser 10 of 1,532 Photo by  PlumGrill3327 11/30/2024 This is good. My first time making brownies. Mine is salty ( Probably the type of salt I use) I thought it was cakey texture but it's was chewy. They top and side is chewy while the middle is cakey. I added my own chocolate chips and I think brownies NEEDS to have chocolate chip. I didn't do the frosting. Definitely trying it again.p.s. I know the cutting is small and bad 😅 I took 5 good pictures but I only can insert 1 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Blueberry Crumb Bars 875 Ratings Avocado Peanut Butter Brownies (Vegan) 23 Ratings Scrumptious Frosted Fudgy Brownies 166 Ratings Blonde Brownies 1,945 Ratings Milly's Oatmeal Brownies 342 Ratings Chunky Cheesecake Brownies 697 Ratings Seven Layer Bars 686 Ratings Continental Brownies 14 Ratings Texas Sheet Cake 855 Ratings Apple Squares 1,537 Ratings Pumpkin Bars I 223 Ratings Bake Sale Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Brownies 41 Ratings Cherry Cheesecake Brownies 24 Ratings Deep-Dish Brownies 1,108 Ratings Layers Of Love Chocolate Brownies 32 Ratings Layered Peanut Butter Brownies 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Angie
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.;Melt 1/2 cup butter in a large saucepan. Remove from heat, and stir in sugar, eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/3 cup cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until top is dry and edges have started to pull away from the sides of the pan, about 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool briefly before frosting.;To make the chocolate frosting: Combine softened butter, confectioners' sugar, 3 tablespoons cocoa, honey, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract in a bowl. Stir until smooth. Frost brownies while they are still warm. Kim
